title: PSA: New Galio is not cocky
body: According to riot (from surrender@20 page) the new Galio rework is not gonna make him some cocky superhero guy, and instead he's going to have a more joyful personality to fit his theme as a demacian protector

replies.body: Maybe not cocky, but he is pretty superhero-y

Will there be any possibility of seeing some of the darker sides of Demacia with Galio's update? Right now Demacia is kind of a boring place that's too perfect, even Lux, who had depth to her lore before, is now just a girl who was so good at magic she was accepted into a prestigious school, instead of a broken child soldier who smiled to make people think everything was fine. She was more relatable, but now it seems like Demacia is just "the perfect place where everyone is amazing."

So will we get to see a darker side to Demacia?
Someone is forgetting about Fiora.

Pfft. Demacia isn't boring. Unless you're a troublemaker/Villain!

Anyway, Demacia mode aside Vayne and Lucian are both from Demacia and are quite edgy already.
I'm not asking for edginess, I'm asking for depth. You know the Mary Sue archetype? That's what demacia is, minus the tragic past. Ironically, that lowers my like of it even more.

Well by the very act of adding lore they get depth.

So I'd wait till they add said lore before making judgment on characters, as they haven't gotten their lore turn yet.

But every champ in Demacia doesn't need darkness in their story.

I'm waiting on a demacia update, to be sure, but until then they're about as shallow as a puddle.

Also, just like you think not every demacian needs darkness, the same could be said for the Noxian champs you view as scum.


Also, if they remove that darkness from Lux, she really loses the depth she had before. She was interesting, had a unique place in the world as the sign that not everything was right with Demacia, and just generally was cool. Now she's some flawless prodigy. And I still think that she can do hundreds of times better than Ez. EVERYONE can do better than Ez.

I don't think Riven is scum. 

Besides, Lux can get depth through some other means.

But Lux was more relatable! I've had a lot of bad stuff along those lines (though thankfully I wasn't forced into the military by my parents), and she was the most relatable champ in the game back then! Now they're making her out to be a beacon of purity, but should make it so that's just what it looks like on the surface.

Relatable to who? Anyway, she should be a beacon of purity, she is the lady of luminosity after all.

She can be the beacon guiding Demacia to be more accepting towards Magic.

Besides, Fiora can be the darker one if you really think Demacia needs one. She already killed her father and rules as the matriarch of a house in a society that believes men should rule.

But her light powers were just her reverse engineering Morg's dark magic in the old lore.

She was relatable to me. I've gone through my entire life being forced into things I don't want, told to do things I didn't want to do, held to higher standards than possible, etc. She, back then, seemed like a relatable champ to me. 

Also, Fiora killed her father because he was cheating. In addition, one person does not a deep nation make. If fiora is the only "dark" champ in demacia, that just makes her the outlier.


In addition, It doesn't really need to be "darker" it just needs to be more realistic. As it is now, Demacia is actually a terrible place because it's completely unrealistic.

> Demacia is actually a terrible place because it's completely unrealistic.

It's a fantasy world though....

Why can't we have the bright places? Every nation doesn't have to be realistic, it's what draws people to fantasy in the first place, to find better lives and realities.

Obviously it doesn't do it for everyone, but it's a reason why I like Demacia. It's so clean. Beautiful, Grand, it's a great place that I'd like to be in.

So in short, everything in a fantasy game doesn't have to be realistic. Idealistic is okay.

Idealistic is okay, but whatever idealistic is fighting has to be either realistic or the epitome of everything wrong in the world.


No jokes, please: do you really want Noxus to be an irredeemable place with all the depth of a saturday morning cartoon villain? Cause that's what it would have to be.

> [{quoted}](name=midnight oil24,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=X0YecOlc,comment-id=000000020000000000000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-03-07T20:29:03.729+0000)
>
> Idealistic is okay, but whatever idealistic is fighting has to be either realistic or the epitome of everything wrong in the world.
> 
> 
> No jokes, please: do you really want Noxus to be an irredeemable place with all the depth of a saturday morning cartoon villain? Cause that's what it would have to be.

Of course not. Noxus would not have to be that way at all just to be Demacia's ancient enemy. We don't even have to deal in idealism vs realistic for them to be enemies.

Let's make a scenario. In their early days they set on different paths. Demacia wants to be left alone to nurture its art, military, and general culture all on its own.

Noxus would rather expand, conquering other nations and adding to its culture via assimilation.

They clash and war because Demacia doesn't bend easily to Noxus. There we go, ancient enemies with no mention of morality or anything.
Well that's a part of Noxus that can't change now.
It could work, but by the very definition of Noxus being the one that wants to conquer, it's already making it villainous.

Noooo
Let something be perfect in this f--- up world!
But if Demacia is perfect, wouldn't they have to make Noxus a ####ed up hellhole with no redeemable people to explain JUSTICE THE PERFECT COUNTRY THAT CAN DO NO WRONG fighting it?

> [{quoted}](name=midnight oil24,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=X0YecOlc,comment-id=00000002,timestamp=2017-03-07T19:50:03.559+0000)
>
> Will there be any possibility of seeing some of the darker sides of Demacia with Galio's update? Right now Demacia is kind of a boring place that's too perfect, even Lux, who had depth to her lore before, is now just a girl who was so good at magic she was accepted into a prestigious school, instead of a broken child soldier who smiled to make people think everything was fine. She was more relatable, but now it seems like Demacia is just "the perfect place where everyone is amazing."
> 
> So will we get to see a darker side to Demacia?

Has any of that lore been removed, though? What we saw in her League Judgment might still be the case, even if the League itself has been removed. Her biography sounds about the same as it did before, after all. All the dark, hidden depths were in her Judgment. The military still recruits her, so while she might've seen her powers as a gift while she was still in the College of Magic, she could've still been torn from her family as soon as her potential was realized by the military. 
I mean, I could be wrong, and they could have entirely removed the darker aspects of her and Demacia's lore, but unless I've missed something, that hasn't been definitively stated, has it? This was her previous lore: http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Lux/History and as we can see, it's practically the same as we can find in her current biography, aside from the missing Judgment which was -always- a pain to find, for all the champions who had them.
We see a bit off dark side with Taric, It cares about DUTY and HONOUR

True. Though I can guarantee you that Demacia Fanboys will rush to the scene yelling about how Demacia was in the right, that Taric should have been a better leader, etc.


If Demacia fans can find an argument, they will use it, no matter how flimsy it is. I've seen a lot like that.

Ahem, "Demacia Fanboys" know that Taric is better off now.

Besides, he left his post and his men to study the wonders of architecture, and they died due to his negligence. Care to explain how this is flimsy in regards to his leadership?

Yeah, he was a sucky leader, but that was also the result of Demacia pushing him into positions he wasn't good for. 

And I wasn't referring to you in particular. I know other, far more obnoxious, Demacia fanboys.
Well that's fine then. As long as you weren't tossing jabs at me. Besides you know I jest.

why not intense patriotism

Galio's thoughts and actions should be utterly unclouded, they are those of justice {{champion:86}}
He is definitely intensely patriotic.
Off topic but how patriotic are Lucian and I think Vayne?

It seems he more into getting into scraps than being about duty though, guy sees a tall dude or someone that looks vaguely like him and he wants to punch him in the face. I thought he'd be more reserved, more like Xin Zhao who could be seen as patriotic and very devoted to his king and adopted country but not quite so "Punching Time Dudes! Check out my marble pecs yo!"

Wasn't he supposed to be sad? Like, you know, current Galio?
I know you're trying to increase appeal, but your own statistics tell you that a certain part of the playerbase is the one who plays all the forgotten champs and the offbuilds. The very fact that these things are left alone, just for us, and our enemies don't know them, is what pulls us to them. Every time you turn them into a meta supahcool archetype, we lose a pick.
Yeah he even does the superhero landing.

Can we pls have a Demacia/Zuan crossover with the dynamic duo Zac and Galio?

Even if it's just a short comic? Rito pls.
